name: Pan Fried Salmon with Romesco Sauce
keywords: Salmon, Easy, Capsicum, Tomato, Nutty, Chili, Creamy, Healthy, Pine Nuts, Roast, Pan Fried, Fish, Seafood, Romesco Sauce, Dinner, Lunch, Quick, Simple, Elegant, Sauce, Red Pepper, Almonds, Garlic, Smoked Paprika, Versatile
description: Easy light salmon meal bursting with flavor with a versatile sauce that can be used many different ways.
recipeIngredient: Pinch of Chili/Cayenne for some kick

recipeInstructions.text: In a large baking tray lay down a single layer of the tomatoes, capsicum and garlic. Try to ensure nothing overlaps but a bit is fine. Coat everything nicely with olive oil and toss to ensure even coating all over. Bake for about 40-60 minutes to ensure you get some nice roasty bits.
recipeInstructions.name: Roast Vegetables

recipeInstructions.text: Add off the sauce ingredients to a pot. Mix everything together, add about 100-200ml of water to make it easier to mix and then whiz.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend Ingredients

recipeInstructions.text: Whizz with a stick blender and get super smooth. For ultimate smoothness, skin the capsicum and tomatoes before adding to the pot. Season with salt, paprika and extra red wine vinegar to taste as desired. Boil down to desired thickness for pasta sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Make Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer back to your baking tray. Bake again for 15-20 mins. This will result in a nice thick roasty sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large pan over medium-high heat. Add the butter and the salmon fillets. Fry the salmon skin side down for 4 minutes, season with salt and pepper, then flip and fry for 3-4 minutes more.
recipeInstructions.name: Pan-fry Salmon

recipeInstructions.text: Serve atop the romesco sauce with roasted pine nuts and basil leaves.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

notes: Great with some grilled carrots or asparagus to mop up the extra sauce.
